title: How can I strengthen my testimony?
short_title: How can I strengthen my testimony?
content: How can I strengthen my testimony?

A testimony is a spiritual witness of the truth given by the Holy Ghost. As members of the Church, we have sacred opportunity and responsibility to obtain our own testimonies. If we seek a testimony through study, prayer, and living the gospel, the Holy Ghost will help us know for ourselves that the gospel is true.
How have you gained your own testimony? How has your testimony influenced your life as a husband, father, priesthood holder, and disciple of Christ?

What do you know about the testimonies of the young men in your quorum? How will having a strong testimony influence their lives now and in the future? What can you do to encourage quorum members to strengthen their testimonies?
Prayerfully study the following scriptures and resources. What do you find that will inspire the young men to gain a testimony?
(If we do the Lord’s will, we will gain a testimony)
(To obtain a testimony, we must ask and seek for one)
(We must study for ourselves before we ask)

The Savior invited His disciples to testify of truth, and as they did, the Spirit touched their hearts. Think about the young men in your class and their life experiences. As you teach, look for opportunities for the young men to share their testimonies about gospel truths—in both formal and informal ways.
